Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer erred by not considering s. 108(4) of IRPA when rejecting the applicants' refugee status
Evidence_Assessment: Applicants had a 'general fear' but were not specifically targeted; Officer concluded they were no longer seriously affected
Legal_Rule: Under IRPA s. 108(4), an Officer must consider compelling reasons arising from past persecution before rejecting a claim, even if country conditions have changed
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider s. 108(4) of IRPA
Grounds_for_Claim: Past persecution and serious personal effects despite changed country conditions
Outcome_on_Merits: Application allowed; matter sent back for reassessment
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer failed to assess required legal provision (s. 108(4))
Key_Evidence_Considered: General fear, lack of specific targeting, past serious personal effects
Applicant_Challenge: Officer did not consider s. 108(4) of IRPA
Court_Result: Federal Court ruled in favor of applicants; case remitted for redetermination
Evidence_Type: Narrative evidence of past persecution, country condition reports
Outcome: Matter sent back for reassessment considering s. 108(4)
Remedy_Sought: Certification of question and return of application for redetermination
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of specific targeting despite past persecution
